{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557551,"name":"Mirza Koçak ","username":"MirzaKocak0","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mirzakocak0/{size}/254879_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T10:21:15.128Z","cooked":"

My team is working on making a new elevator for the off season and I wondered what chief delphi folks thought about it. I would appreciate it if you could state it below.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-15T10:21:15.128Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":68,"reads":459,"readers_count":458,"score":446.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"Mirza Koçak ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60733,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"MirzKoc"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3557561,"name":"","username":"Tedzzy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/eb8c5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T11:09:37.298Z","cooked":"

Light

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-15T11:09:37.298Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":440,"readers_count":439,"score":93.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5737→9411→10558"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3557564,"name":"Kevin ","username":"kr1699","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kr1699/{size}/207533_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T11:21:24.055Z","cooked":"

This year was our first year making an elevator so we put a lot of focus on anti trapezoidal plates across each stage to keep the extrusion parallel.

Definitely look at other teams from this year, especially open alliance teams with public cad, and I encourage you to ask them questions as they can explain their design choices. A lot of teams have been doing elevators for a very long time.

Finally, think about how you’re going to know your elevator’s position, and how you’re going to zero it.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-15T11:21:24.055Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":435,"readers_count":434,"score":162.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"Kevin ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61741,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559160,"name":"Chase Vendrillo","username":"Chase1699","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chase1699/{size}/230099_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T13:05:35.541Z","cooked":"

For speed, weight management, f=ma, you your motor applies a force the lighter your elevator is the faster it can accelerate. Less weight requires less torque from the motor, it allows you to have a lower gear reduction for the motor that runs your extension. For stability, having anti trapezoid plates will help the wobble of each individual stage. Having as much overlap as possible between stages helps keep each stage moving about another more stable. For efficiency, you need an elevator that is robust, you should have good stops and be able to run the elevator without fear. A lot of good teams this year when they go to do something requiring a lot of height you will hear clinks, that’s their elevators hitting their stops at a relatively fast speed and they can do this through the season with probably some fixes here and there. I’d recommend putting a trapezoid in the acceleration at least as you approach the stop just to decrease the wear.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T13:05:35.541Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":346,"readers_count":345,"score":109.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"Chase Vendrillo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58319,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1699 Captain"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559178,"name":"Emre ","username":"DukeEmree","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T13:36:36.846Z","cooked":"

As a programmer less weight, simple scoring and intaking mechanism and limit switch at the bottom is important I think. We have large and heavy(carries 18kg) elevator it can extend in 1 second. But probably simple elevator with arm is better.

Well I am definitely not an expert in this topic but something Golden Horn (8159) use, are constant force springs which take away weight for the motors so they can have a ratio with less torque and more speed. And like that it’s faster. If I understood it correctly.
Here’s the video from in which they also explain it a bit.

Chase1699:

having anti trapezoid plates

What do these look like?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T14:07:11.880Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":64.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559230,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T14:17:11.742Z","cooked":"

We are no experts, this was our first elevator. And we bought the Thriftybot elevator and are very happy with it. We did make some changes to it to fit our use case. This is a collection of some of the advice I’ve given other teams.

  • Packaging matters, think about where you want your motors to go. And depending on your gearing how much space they take up. We ended up making custom motor plates to accommodate 90 degree gear boxes.

  • use good quality bearing blocks for the lift.

  • beware of torsional forces on your cage. It will bend the screw holding the cage on the inner cage which will cause it to be loose. You can also mitigate it by adding additional bearing blocks to the inner cage if weight is a problem

  • the current plateau trick works wonders for resetting the zero of the lift without a sensor

  • keep in mind that sprockets can take damage as can your spring over time. So design them to be checked and replaced as needed.

  • we prefer double chains, as we’ve learned the hard way to build redundant systems.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T14:21:30.728Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":189,"readers_count":188,"score":82.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"Chase Vendrillo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58319,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1699 Captain"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559245,"name":"Kyle Swaidner","username":"kswaid","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/df788c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T14:28:09.200Z","cooked":"

One thing I have seen a lot of teams miss this year is properly bracing the fixed stage of the elevator to the chassis. Your elevator is only as strong (and stiff) as the connection back to the base. A common method to achieve this is using spherical bearing rod ends with round tube braces to brace in 2 directions with a single structural member.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T14:28:09.200Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":121.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"Kyle Swaidner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26091,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC #1740 Cyber Colonels"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559266,"name":"Marc Antinossi","username":"antinos","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/antinos/{size}/187791_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T14:55:43.371Z","cooked":"

My first true deep dive into researching how to design elevators was by reviewing the assembly guides for both the WCP Greyt elevator kit and The Thrifty Bot elevator kit:

WestCoast Products

GreyT Cascade Elevator

The Greyt Elevator is back with a 4th iteration! Elevators can be used to lift objects high above the robot without extending reach and center of gravity outside the robot the way an arm does. It can also lift the robot as well!   Single...

Price: USD 299.99

The Thrifty Bot

Thrifty Elevator Stage Kit

02/19/25 Thrifty Elevator Kit Update: Thrifty Elevator Kits - Elevator kits are back in stock Thrifty Elevator is designed to work with the various brands of 2 in. x 1 in. aluminum box extrusion of any wall thickness on the market. Your team can work...

Price: USD 389.00

These guides were valuable for understanding the fundamentals of elevator design - where to put the bearing blocks, how to support each stage, how to rig all the stages together, etc. it then becomes a bit easier to look at other teams’ CAD to gather ideas on more elegant or efficient features and solutions.

We had both of these assembly guides and CAD open as references as we designed this year’s elevator, which ended up being an amalgamation of these two kits with some features borrowed from various elevators from 4414, 1678, 2910, and others. Our elevator works quite well and it’s because the Greyt kit and TTB kit serve as great design foundations.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T14:55:43.371Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":69.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"Marc Antinossi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://wcproducts.com/collections/systems-structure/products/greyt-cascade-elevator","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GreyT Cascade Elevator – WestCoast Products","clicks":5},{"url":"https://www.thethriftybot.com/products/thrifty-elevator-stage-kit","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Thrifty Elevator Stage Kit","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57804,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"573 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/12","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559308,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T15:31:11.471Z","cooked":"

Stiffness is the most important by a lot. Stiff elevators do what you or your auto tell them to do. This means you want sell-built crossbars diagonal bracing on the 1st stage, and possibly diagonal bracing inside the stages to keep things stiff. You aren’t scoring or driving when waiting for your elevator to stop oscillating. Beams in bending are bad and should always be avoided.

#2 is attention to detail. Perfect execution on rigging and good tolerances increase reliability and decrease maintainence required on elevators, and just makes everything easier.

Only after the first two do I consider weight. Yes it’s important, but 10 out of 10 times, I will take a heavy but stiff elevator over a light elevator with stiffness issues. And we’ve seem this time and time again with the most notable example in recent years being 1323 2023. Fridge heavy, but fridge stiff and therefore is good to the point that they were the best bot despite being max weight.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T15:31:11.471Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":79.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/13","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559377,"name":"Josh (he/him)","username":"Josh_Fox","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/josh_fox/{size}/119506_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T16:48:25.622Z","cooked":"
kswaid:

One thing I have seen a lot of teams miss this year is properly bracing the fixed stage of the elevator to the chassis. Your elevator is only as strong (and stiff) as the connection back to the base. A common method to achieve this is using spherical bearing rod ends with round tube braces to brace in 2 directions with a single structural member.

The introduction of Rev’s 1/2"x1/2" tubing has been great for adding some lightweight stiffening members to small spaces for us this year as well, would definitely recommend it.

Anti trapezoiddal plates?

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T18:20:12.930Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495650,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient","display_username":"M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"Regular","title_is_group":false,"reply_to_user":{"id":61741,"username":"kr1699","name":"Kevin ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kr1699/{size}/207533_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68890,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"D/N/A"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-think-are-the-essentials-for-a-very-good-elevator-that-is-stable-fast-and-efficient/495650/16","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559561,"name":"Kevin ","username":"kr1699","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kr1699/{size}/207533_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T18:42:44.101Z","cooked":"

I’m not sure if there’s an official name for them but that’s what our team has referred to the plates across each stage as.

IMG_89261170×2532 436 KB

They help ensure our elevator stays as a rectangle rather than becoming a trapezoid, hence the name.

Our braces are arranged like this:
